revised_title: William Wallace Campbell: A Pioneering Astronomer
tldr: William Wallace Campbell was a renowned astronomer who made significant contributions to the field of astronomy, particularly in the areas of spectroscopy and radial velocities. He worked at the Lick Observatory and played a crucial role in the development of the Mills spectrograph, which allowed for the determination of radial velocities with unprecedented accuracy. Campbell's work on spectroscopic binaries and the solar motion helped shape our understanding of the universe and paved the way for future advancements in astronomy.
